feed.title: Current Watches, Warnings and Advisories for the United States Issued by the National Weather Service

entry.title: High Surf Advisory issued October 02 at 2:54PM AKDT until October 03 at 4:00PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...HIGH SURF ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 PM AKDT MONDAY... * LOCATION...The Kuskokwim Delta Coast, including Kuskokwim Bay. * WAVES AND SURF...Water levels are expected to rise 2 to 4 feet above the normal highest tide line with this surf. * TIMING...The primary impact period will be at or around high tide Monday morning.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued October 02 at 1:47PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Strong Storm Moving to Wrangel Island by Thursday Morning... A strong storm will develop in the Sea of Ohkotsk Monday night and move across Chukotka Wednesday, to Wrangel Island by Thursday morning. Strong southerly to southwesterly winds are expected to accompany this storm as it moves into the Arctic with winds turning
entry.cap:areaDesc: Northern Arctic Coast; Western Arctic Coast

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued October 02 at 1:47PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Strong Storm Moving to the Bering and Chukchi Wednesday to Friday... A strong storm will develop in the Sea of Ohkotsk Monday night and move to Chukotka Wednesday, and to Wrangel Island by Thursday morning. Strong southerly to southwesterly winds are expected to accompany
entry.cap:areaDesc: Baldwin Peninsula and Selawik Valley; Chukchi Sea Coast; Eastern Norton Sound and Nulato Hills; Southern Seward Peninsula Coast; St Lawrence Island and Bering Strait Coast

entry.title: High Surf Advisory issued October 02 at 10:28AM SST by NWS
entry.summary: ...High Surf Advisory remains in effect... * WHAT...Surf of 10 to 12 feet * WHERE...Southern and eastern showers of all islands * WHEN...through Tuesday * IMPACTS...Minor. Expect some strong breaking waves, shorebreak, and strong longshore and rip currents making water recreation
entry.cap:areaDesc: Manua; Swains Island; Tutuila and Aunuu

entry.title: Flash Flood Warning issued October 02 at 5:16PM MST until October 02 at 7:15PM MST by NWS
entry.summary: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 715 PM MST THIS EVENING FOR CENTRAL MOHAVE COUNTY... At 516 PM MST, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly along Antares as well as Buck and Doe Road north of State Route 66.

entry.title: Flash Flood Warning issued October 02 at 4:07PM MST until October 02 at 6:00PM MST by NWS
entry.summary: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM MST THIS EVENING FOR SOUTH CENTRAL MOHAVE COUNTY... At 407 PM MST, Doppler radar indicated consistent thunderstorms producing moderate rain across the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly on the eastern side of the Hualapai Mountains.

entry.title: Flood Advisory issued October 02 at 4:14PM PDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 630 PM PDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of southern California, including the following county, Riverside. * WHEN...Until 630 PM PDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas.

entry.title: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued October 02 at 6:43PM MDT until October 02 at 7:00PM MDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 700 PM MDT FOR SOUTH CENTRAL MONTROSE COUNTY... At 643 PM MDT, a severe thunderstorm was located 8 miles northeast of Nucla moving northeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated.

entry.title: Flood Warning issued October 02 at 10:10AM EDT until October 04 at 2:00AM EDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Florida... St Johns River Near Cocoa 9w affecting Brevard County. .Excessive rainfall from recent Tropical Cyclone Ian has placed the Saint Johns River near Cocoa 9W in Minor Flood Stage and it is forecast to remain near this level through early next week, before gradually falling to Action Stage midweek.

entry.title: Flood Warning issued October 02 at 10:06AM EDT until further notice by NWS
entry.summary: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Florida... St Johns River Near Astor affecting Volusia and Lake Counties. .Historic rainfall from Hurricane Ian will cause levels along the Saint Johns River to continue to rise as rainfall drains into the basin. The forecast point at Astor remains close to Record Flood Stage. The river is expected remain near crest through the weekend

entry.title: Flood Warning issued October 02 at 9:53AM EDT until further notice by NWS
entry.summary: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Florida... St Johns River Near Deland affecting Volusia and Lake Counties. .Historic rainfall from Hurricane Ian will cause levels along the Saint Johns river to continue to rise as rainfall drains into the basin. The forecast point at Deland is currently in Major Flood Stage and expected to continue to rise through midweek next week.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued October 02 at 2:42PM EDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Patchy frost possible across northern portions of central Indiana late tonight... Isolated locations across northern portions of central Indiana could see frost late tonight. Frost should be limited to a few normally colder low-lying rural locations, and will not be widespread.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued October 02 at 2:41PM EDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Patchy Frost Tonight... Temperatures tonight will be conducive for the formation of patchy frost. Frost could harm plants and sensitive outdoor vegetation if left uncovered. Take steps now to protect tender plants from the cold.
